{"step_by_step_thinking": "Deep vein thrombosis (DVT) prophylaxis is typically achieved with anticoagulants such as heparin or low molecular weight heparin (LMWH). These drugs work by enhancing the activity of antithrombin III, which in turn inhibits several factors in the coagulation cascade, including factor X. Therefore, the factor most directly affected by DVT prophylaxis is factor X.", "answer_choice": "C. X"}
